content.text:
# APRA Music Awards of 1993

| location       = Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
| website        =
| network        =
| runtime        =
| ratings        =
| previous       = 1992
| main           = APRA Music Awards
| next           = 1994
}}
The Australasian Performing Right Association Awards of 1993 (generally known as APRA Awards) are a series of awards, which were held at the Regent Hotel, Sydney, in November 1993. The APRA Music Awards were presented by Australasian Performing Right Association (APRA) and the Australasian Mechanical Copyright Owners Society (AMCOS).
Awards
Winners are shown in bold with known nominees shown in plain.
{| class="wikitable"
|-
! Category
! Details
! Result

| Greg Arnold
|
|-

| Peter Sculthorpe
|

|
|-

|
|-
| "Happy Birthday Helen" (Greg Arnold) by Things of Stone and Wood
|
|-

|
|-

|
|-

|
|-

|
|-
| "Fifteen Minutes of Fame" (C Stockley, G Young) by Cameron Daddo

|-
|"Funky Zoo" (Kenneth Ian Stewart) by Ken Stewart

|-

|-

|
|-

|

| Most Performed Foreign Work
| "'''You Don't Treat Me No Good" (Daniel Pritzker, Daniel Laszlo) by Sonia Dada
|
|-
| Most Performed Australian Work
| "Daddy's Gonna Make You a Star" (Simon Hussey, Jef Scott, James Reyne) by Company of Strangers

|-

|
|-
| Television or Film Theme of the Year
| Phoenix (Series 2) (Paul Grabowsky) by Paul Grabowsky'''
